headline.main: Soccer-Brazil Vow to Improve After 0-0 Draw
headline.print_headline: Soccer-Brazil Vow to Improve After 0-0 Draw

docs.snippet: Brazil's inability to score against 10-man South Africa was just a bad day at the office and the hosts will work hard to improve before their next game against Iraq, several players said on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Brazil's inability to score against 10-man South Africa was just a bad day at the office and the hosts will work hard to improve before their next game against Iraq, several players said on Thursday.

headline.main: Queen Portrait That Hung in Winnipeg Arena Looking for Home
headline.print_headline: Queen Portrait That Hung in Winnipeg Arena Looking for Home

docs.snippet: The large portrait of Queen Elizabeth II that once watched over hockey games at Winnipeg Arena is again looking for a home....
docs.lead_paragraph: The large portrait of Queen Elizabeth II that once watched over hockey games at Winnipeg Arena is again looking for a home.

headline.main: California Wardens Retire Amid Prison Abuse, Suicide Claims
headline.print_headline: California Wardens Retire Amid Prison Abuse, Suicide Claims

docs.snippet: The wardens at California's two major women's prisons have retired amid allegations of pervasive problems at both institutions, including sexual abuse of female inmates at one prison and suicides at the other....
docs.lead_paragraph: The wardens at California's two major women's prisons have retired amid allegations of pervasive problems at both institutions, including sexual abuse of female inmates at one prison and suicides at the other.

headline.main: Colombia May Vote on Peace Before Final Accord Signed-President
headline.print_headline: Colombia May Vote on Peace Before Final Accord Signed-President

docs.snippet: Colombia could hold a public vote to approve a peace accord with Marxist FARC rebels and end more than five decades of war before the deal is formally signed, President Juan Manuel Santos said on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Colombia could hold a public vote to approve a peace accord with Marxist FARC rebels and end more than five decades of war before the deal is formally signed, President Juan Manuel Santos said on Thursday.

headline.main: San Francisco Gangster 'Shrimp Boy' Sentenced to Life in Prison
headline.print_headline: San Francisco Gangster 'Shrimp Boy' Sentenced to Life in Prison

docs.snippet: San Francisco gangster Raymond "Shrimp Boy" Chow was sentenced on Thursday to life in prison after his conviction on dozens of federal charges, including ordering the murder of a Chinatown rival, a U.S. Department of Justice spokesman said....
docs.lead_paragraph: San Francisco gangster Raymond "Shrimp Boy" Chow was sentenced on Thursday to life in prison after his conviction on dozens of federal charges, including ordering the murder of a Chinatown rival, a U.S. Department of Justice spokesman said.

headline.main: Women Take Centre Stage First as Rugby Returns to Olympics
headline.print_headline: Women Take Centre Stage First as Rugby Returns to Olympics

docs.snippet: Rugby will return to the Olympic arena for the first time since 1924 when 14 women from France and Spain take to the pitch on Saturday for the opening match of the sevens competition at the Rio de Janeiro Games....
docs.lead_paragraph: Rugby will return to the Olympic arena for the first time since 1924 when 14 women from France and Spain take to the pitch on Saturday for the opening match of the sevens competition at the Rio de Janeiro Games.

headline.main: 1st Woman to Win Tennessee Statewide Election Dies at 83
headline.print_headline: 1st Woman to Win Tennessee Statewide Election Dies at 83

docs.snippet: Jane Eskind, the first woman to win a statewide election in Tennessee and a longtime Democratic Party activist, died Thursday. She was 83....
docs.lead_paragraph: Jane Eskind, the first woman to win a statewide election in Tennessee and a longtime Democratic Party activist, died Thursday. She was 83.

headline.main: Proud Murray Working on Flag-Bearing Technique
headline.print_headline: Proud Murray Working on Flag-Bearing Technique

docs.snippet: Andy Murray says carrying the British flag at Friday's Olympic opening ceremony will be his proudest day but admits his technique needs some work....
docs.lead_paragraph: Andy Murray says carrying the British flag at Friday's Olympic opening ceremony will be his proudest day but admits his technique needs some work.
